content.question: After a tropical storm in a certain state, news reports indicated that 19 percent of households in the state lost power during the storm. A state engineer believes that estimate is too low. The engineer will collect data to perform a hypothesis test on the proportion of all households without power. Which of the following are the appropriate hypotheses for such a test?

choices.label: <math alttext="H sub 0: p hat equals 0.19. H sub a: p hat is less than 0.19." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>0.19</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mover accent="true"><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover><mo><</mo><mn>0.19</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: p hat equals 0.19. topic.text: 6.4: Setting Up a Test for a Population Proportion

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Identify null and alternative hypotheses.
